env.name: CONTEXT_PATH
env.label: Context Path for setting url-base in reverse proxy setups

title: HTPC Manager
description: Web Front-End for Home Theater PCs

env.name: ONLY_SUBDOMAINS
env.label: Generate certificates for subdomains, not the main domain (default is false)

env.name: WEBADDRESS
env.label: IP Address of the server running Musicbrainz

env.name: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD
env.label: Mandatory.  Specifies the password that will be set for the MySQL root superuser account.

env.name: MYSQL_DATABASE
env.label: Optional.  Allows you to specify the name of a database to be created on image startup. If a user/password was supplied (see additional variables) then that user will be granted superuser access (corresponding to GRANT ALL) to this database.

env.name: MYSQL_USER
env.label: Optional.  Used to create a new user.  This user will be granted superuser permissions (see above) for the database specified by the MYSQL_DATABASE variable. This variable and MYSQL_PASSWORD variables are required for a user to be created.  Use the MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD variable separately to set the database root user password.

env.name: MYSQL_PASSWORD
env.label: Optional.  Used in conjunction to create a new user and to set that user's password. This user will be granted superuser permissions for the database specified by the MYSQL_DATABASE variable.  Both variables are required for a user to be created.  Use the MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD variable separately to set the database root user password.

env.name: MYSQL_ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD
env.label: Optional. Set to yes to allow the container to be started with a blank password for the root user. NOTE: Setting this variable to yes is not recommended unless you really know what you are doing, since this will leave your MySQL instance completely unprotected, allowing anyone to gain complete superuser access.

env.name: MYSQL_RANDOM_ROOT_PASSWORD
env.label: Optional. Set to yes to generate a random initial password for the root user (using pwgen). The generated root password will be printed to stdout (GENERATED ROOT PASSWORD: .....).

env.name: MYSQL_ONETIME_PASSWORD
env.label: Sets root (not the user specified in MYSQL_USER!) user as expired once init is complete, forcing a password change on first login. NOTE: This feature is supported on MySQL 5.6+ only. Using this option on MySQL 5.5 will throw an appropriate error during initialization.

env.name: INTERFACE
env.label: Interface in container (bridge networking) or on

env.name: PGID
env.label: Group ID for user in the container

env.name: PUID
env.label: User ID for user in the container

title: OpenVPN Client
description: OpenVPN Client for routing Docker traffic

env.name: CERT_AUTH
env.label: Configure an authentication password to open the cert (Optional)

env.name: DNS
env.label: Use the VPN provider's DNS resolvers (IP address or leave empty.  Optional)

env.name: FIREWALL
env.label: Set Firewall to restrict Internet traffic if VPN is offline (Port number or leave empty. Optional)

env.name: MSS
env.label: Maximum Segment Size (Size in bytes or leave empty. Optional)

env.name: ROUTE6
env.label: IPv6 Network for which to add a route (IPv6 CIDR or leave empty. Optional)

env.name: ROUTE
env.label: IPv4 Network for which to add a route (IPv4 CIDR or leave empty. Optional)

env.name: VPN
env.label: VPN server to connect. (vpn.domain.com;username;password or leave empty. Optional)

env.name: VPNPORT
env.label: Set up port forwarding. Can be used multiple times by appending numbers such as _1, _2, etc. (Port number or leave empty. Optional)

env.name: GROUPID
env.label: Set the Group ID for the VPN user. (Optional)

env.name: ADVERTISE_IP
env.label: Additional IPs on which the server may be found (for use with bridge networking)

env.name: ALLOWED_NETWORKS
env.label: CIDR notation for networks whitelisted against authentication

env.name: CHANGE_CONFIG_DIR_OWNERSHIP
env.label: Change ownership of Plex config directory (defaults to true)

env.name: PLEX_CLAIM
env.label: One-use claim token to activate a server (ignored if already active. obtain at https://www.plex.tv/claim)

env.name: PLEX_GID
env.label: Group ID for Plex user in the container

env.name: PLEX_UID
env.label: User ID for Plex user in the container

env.name: WEBUI_PORT
env.label: For changing the port of the Web UI
